data.text:
Who was Kobe Bryant

Kobe Bryant was one of the greatest Basketball players that entered the National Basketball Association (NBA). He played for the Los Angelas Lakers for his whole career. Bryant one 5 championships in his career. He was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame in 2021. Kobe Bryant was a 6 foot 6 guard that was one of the only people to enter the NBA straight from High School. Kobe Bryant was a standout player. Many college's wanted to recruit him. But he decided that he was ready for the NBA. He was drafted by the Charlotte Hornets, and then was traded to the Los Angeles Lakers the same night. Bryant was an 18 time all star. He was also rewarded with the MVP (Most Valuable Player) award in 2008. In 2008 and 2012 he helped Men's Basketball USA Olympic team win the gold medal.

Early Life

Kobe Bean Bryant was born on August 23rd 1978 in Philadelphia. His father, Joe Bryant, was an NBA Player. When Bryant was only six years old, his family moved to Italy. His father continued to play basketball there. Bryant liked living in Italy and spoke some fluent Italian. Bryant loved living in the town of Reggio Emilia. He also became friends with a future (Women's National Basketball Association) WNBA Star, Tamika catchings, who's father also played basketball in Italy. Bryant begin playing basketball in Italy. However, the rims and nets were smaller than used in America. The Italian Coaches stressed fundamentals in flashy plays. Bryant became an expert at passing the ball and moving on the court.

Early Life

Kobe Bryant returned to Philadelphia in the summers. Although the adjustments were not easy, he was struggling to score points on the courts. "I didn't score a point this whole summer. Not one point. Not a free throw, not a layup. Nothing, zero points the whole summer," Bryant recalled. "My father came up to me afterwords and said, son, don't worry about it. We are going to love you if you score zero or 50." Bryant's family moved back to the United States when he was 13 years old. But he never forgot his experiences in Italy. Bryant often returned to the country. He would surprise youth basketball teams in Reggio Emilia.

High School

Bryant attended Lower Marian High School in the Philadelphia suburbs. He was the rare freshman who started on the varsity team. Bryant's team was not very good in his first season. They won only four games. However, Bryant stood out as a talented player. Bryant's ability took center stage his junior year. He averaged 31.1 points and 10.4 rebounds for Lower Merion. Hew as named Pennsylvania State Player of the Year. Colleges across the country began expressing interest. Bryant further raised his profile with strong performances in elite summer camp. During his senior season, Bryant was even better. He averaged 30.8 points and 12 rebounds to lead the Aces to the state championship. In his las three years of high school, the Aces went 77-13.
